issues.summary: Location – The system does not evaluate the 'active' and 'deleted' flags of the Company Code while creating a Location
issues.description:
Issue:  Location – The system does not evaluate the 'active' and 'deleted' flags of the Company Code while creating a Location Server: URL: devQA35-go.vroozi.com Username:  notifyvroozi3@gmail.com Password: @Welcome1 Pre-Condition: API integration is configured and enabled on the relevant server. In the specified  unit_id , there exists at least one  deleted  or  inactive  Company Code with  locationTypeRequired set to  true . Steps to Reproduce: Send a request to create a  Location  element using a minimal payload. curl --location 'https://devqa2-api.vroozi.com/v1/locations' \
--header 'Content-Type:  application/json' \
--header 'Authorization:  eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiJ9.eyJBUFBfSUQiOiJmOWY2ZWNjYy02Y2MxLTRhYWQtYTIwMi00ZGQ3MGE5MWJiMmQiLCJVTklUX0lEIjoiMiIsIlJBTkRPTV9OVU1CRVIiOiJkYmFmY2Y3My00OTJmLTQ5OWItODgyNS0wZjdjNTNhZDc0NGIifQ.kDpEZ4lgI6Lr3v1A8yGrdupZpiu6ZM5pEYUTI2DcWU4cIV6M8x_Jv_YsDJIy4VuaOHYSZwIAj--RMo62FkuBmA' \
--header 'x-api-key:  rlVKqJfIzb2FDhCbtXNlza3J0G7Ybige7FhqgvHB' \
--data '{
    "code": "Bajwa-02",
    "name": "Location",
    "enableForAllCompanyCodes": true,
    "active": true
}' Verify the response Actual Result: The system doesn’t process the request successfully and throws an error related to the Location Type. {
    "id": "86fde126-1648-4fe5-8d15-39ace6cec5a4",
    "status": "400",
    "title": "Bad Request",
    "errors": [
        {
            "code": "400",
            "element": "locationTypeRef",
            "message": "Field [Location Type] cannot be null or empty.",
            "detail": "",
            "level": "Request Error"
        }
    ],
    "timestamp": "2025-04-16T10:41:59.710+0000"
} Expected Result: The system should process the request successfully with the minimal payload, and it should exclude deleted or inactive Company Codes when creating a Location.

issues.summary: Integrate PresidioReversibleAnonymizer into LangChain for PII Anonymization
issues.description: Goal Enable privacy-preserving processing in our LangChain workflow by ensuring all PII is anonymized before LLM processing and restored afterward, without compromising functionality or requiring extensive refactoring. Details Enable the functionality for the Smart Chat(excluding RAG functionality) Implement  PresidioReversibleAnonymizer  in our LangChain-based workflow to anonymize and deanonymize PII (e.g., names, email, phone numbers, Mongo DB IDs like 672ca0c487e3a613688f6539) seamlessly. Ensure compatibility with tool calls, retries, and streaming, maintaining a single anonymizer instance for consistent mapping. Target minimal code changes for maintainability. Make the anonymization tool configurable

issues.summary: PROD - Accounts Payable - Create Invoice - Location Missing Error shows even its selected against the line item.
issues.description: Environment: https://stage-go.vroozi.com  /  https://go.vroozi.com Username :  asma.latif+APM@vroozi.com  / asma.latif+APM@vroozi.com Password:  Blueangel1@ / Blueangel1! Pre-Requisites: Feature Toggle ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW_ENHANCED_WORKFLOW should be enabled for the Unitid in DB. Feature Toggle "ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW__DOCUMENT_SETTINGS_CONFIGURATION" should be enabled for the Unitid in DB. Location field is set Required in the PMAN>Document>Settings>All> LI Config >Accounting Section.  Class field is set Optional in the PMAN>Document>Settings>All> LI Config >Accounting Section.  AP User should have logged into the Application.  Steps to Reproduce: Click to Create Invoice.  9000031471(Stage) / 9000010629(Prod) Add Header Details. Click to Add Item. Add details on both General Info and Accounting tabs with Location selected also. Click the tick mark to save item. Please see Location missing error starts showing. Edit Open the Item and select a Class too in the Accounting tab. Click the tick mark to save item. Please see this time item saves with Location missing error removed. Actual Result: Location missing error starts showing even location has been selected and saved for the item. Expected Result: Location error message should not show. Screen-Shot: Stage PROD Thanks, Asma Investigation When we are checking for empty location we are using the “classRef” field instead of the “location” one. So we need to fix it: (In  APDocumentRequiredFieldsValidationServiceImpl )

issues.summary: Multi Unit ID: User is not being taken to the correct document, in the appropriate child unitID when user opens document from email
issues.description: This ticket has been converted into a SPIKE, so that the team can determine the LOE required to fulfil these requirements.  Note: We will NOT be able to go-live without addressing the scenarios documented in this ticket High-level reqs: When a user clicks on the action button in an email notification, they should be taken to the appropriate document, in the correct unitID.  For users that were created within a single unitiD, the system should continue working as it does today.  For users that have access to multiple unitIDs, the system should intelligently authenticate them against the Parent unitID, and then automatically route them to the correct child unitID, and the correct document within that child unitID. Emails list: Financial approver Sourcing Approver Budget Approver Emails send to Requester user informing about PO (in  this user is being thrown out of system, once user tries to login by clicking “View Purchase Order” Email sent to Requester on PR approval:  'Your purchase request has been approved.' Email sent to Buyer to create PO:  'Ready for Sourcing: Purchase Request 1000012102' Email sent to buyer when he create PO:  'PO 2000009436 has been created and sent out to Ayesha-001' Email sent to requester when buyer rejects PR:  'Your purchase request has been rejected' Email sent to Requester once supplier provides Bid: “ ABC Supplier  has submitted bid for RFQ #”. Email sent to Buyer once supplier provides Bid: “ ABC Supplier  has submitted bid for RFQ #”. – When RFQ is created by buyer. Email sent to Requester once buyer Assign PR number: “ABC Buyer has assigned PR #“. Rejection emails from sourcing approver :  'Your Purchase Request 1000012091 for Sourcing Review has been Rejected.' Sourcing Approver forwards email  'You have received a purchase request for approval from Ayesha Employee' Rejection emails from Financial approver:  'Your purchase request has been rejected.' issues.summary: QA: Automatically log out any user whose account is deleted, deactivated by a Master Admin, or their access to the current unitID is revoked.
Parent unitID - Master Admins should be able to delete user records from the Parent unitID
issues.description: Business Case: Allow Master Admins, to delete user records for users that were created in the Parent unitID. This should subsequently delete the corresponding user records created in any of the linked child unitIDs that the affected user may have had access to. The user deletion option should not permanently remove the user records from the database layer, as doing so will have negative repercussions throughout the system. instead, these records should be flagged, so they longer show up in an interactive manner, within the applciation. Acceptance Criteira: Prerequisites: The user carrying out these operations should be logged into the Parent unitID The user carrying out these operations should have the Master Admin role assigned to them within the context of the Parent unitID The user being affected by these operations should have been created in the Parent unitID, with a non-Admin role Deleting a user record in the Parent unitID: The Master should be able to click on the “delete” icon for an individual user record, in the user management table.  Clicking on this icon should display a secondary pop-up message for the Master Admin, as king them to confirm that they want to proceed with the intended action.  The modal should have the title “ Are you sure? “ The modal should display the message “ Deleting a user will remove their ability to access any of the business units they may have had access to. This is a non-reversible action. Are you sure you want to proceed with this? “ The modal should present the user with 2 buttons;  Cancel  and  Yes . Clicking on cancel should dismiss the modal, and the system’s state should not change as a result. The affected user’s records will remain as they were.  Clicking on Yes, will proceed with the user record deletion.  Effect of user record deletion on the system’s state: Once a user’s record has been deleted by a Master Admin; via the Parent unitID, the system should …  Mark the affected user’s record as “deleted” in the Parent unitID, so that the user is no longer able to access the Parent unitID. Their user is not visible in the user management table. Nor is their user surfaced as an active, selectable option anywhere in the unitID.  Mark the affected user’s record as “deleted” in all the Child unitIDs that the user had access to, so that the user is no longer able to access those child unitIDs. Their user is not visible in the user management table. Nor is their user surfaced as an active, selectable option anywhere in the unitID. The system should retain all user records at the database layer, so any programmatic / data references to that record remain intact, and none of the system’s functionality breaks as a result of this “deletion”. Effect on a user’s active session(s), if their record is deleted by a Master Admin: If a user is logged into an active session, when the Master Admin deletes their user record from the Parent unitID, that user needs to be automatically logged out of all active sessions.

issues.summary: Allow a Master Admin to revoke access to a specific child unitID via the user record in the Parent unitID
issues.description: When a user is reactivated by the Master Admin, ONLY access to the child unitID’s specified in their user record should be reinstated.  What if a child unitID Admin tries to create a user record, for a user that was already provisioned via the linked Parent unitID? Answer: The system should show an appropriate error message. (This should be handled in a separate ticket, at a later date.) Business Case:   Master Admins need the ability to manage user access efficiently across linked child unitIDs from within the Parent unitID. This includes the capability to revoke a user’s access to a specific child unitID when necessary. Currently, while users can be assigned access to multiple child unitIDs, there is no streamlined process for revoking access at the Parent unitID level. Implementing this feature ensures better control over user permissions, reduces security risks, and aligns with governance policies. Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The user must have been originally provisioned via the Parent unitID. The user performing these actions should be a Master Admin, and present in the Parent unitID. Access Revocation Execution: Master Admins should be able to navigate to the user management screen in the Parent unitID. Master Admins should be able to revoke access to a child unitID, by clicking on the "x" within the "pill" representing that specific unitID, within the "<add field label here>" field. Confirmation Message: When a Master Admin clicks on the "x" for a child unitID, a confirmation message should appear. The message should inform the Admin of the consequences of revoking access, including: The user will lose access to the selected child unitID. The action is reversible only from the Parent unitID. The user record in the Parent unitID will retain necessary data for potential reinstatement. Message to be displayed in the confirmation modal:  'You are about to revoke this user's access to [Child UnitID]. This action will immediately remove their ability to operate within this account. If needed, access can be restored later. Are you sure you want to proceed?' The message should include options to  Confirm  or  Cancel  the action. Effects of Revocation: Once confirmed, the following actions should occur: The user should no longer have access to the revoked child unitID. The child unitID should no longer appear in the user’s record within the Parent unitID as an accessible option. The user’s profile should be removed from the child unitID’s user management list. All permissions and configurations for that child unitID should be archived for potential restoration. The user’s Change history should be updated with the details of this event.  The event should record this change the same way that removing values from other multi-select fields (e.g. the Company Code field in the Access section) works. The main change should be displayed in the audit log as “ The value in <field display name> was modified. “ Underneath this, the system should display exactly what change was made, “ - Removed: Business Unit - <Company Name of the Child unitID that was removed> “ Data Retention for Future Restoration: The system should retain the user’s prior configurations for the revoked child unitID. If access is later reinstated, the system should restore the user’s previous configurations by default, if still valid. If any previous configurations are no longer valid, affected fields should be left empty for manual reassignment. Restoration Process & Configuration Validation: If a Master Admin chooses to restore access to the revoked child unitID: The child unitID should be re-added to the user’s accessible unitIDs list. The system should verify the validity of previously assigned configurations. If any settings are outdated or unavailable …  For single select fields, the system should remove the old value and leave them empty For multi-select fields, the system should highlight the affected “pill” with an orange border, show a “?” icon in the pill, where hovering over it will show a message to the Master Admin letting them know what the problem is.  Error Handling: If access revocation fails due to system issues, an error message should notify the Admin and prompt a retry. The message should read: 'An error occurred while revoking access to [Child UnitID]. Please try again. If the issue persists, contact support.' This message should be clearly displayed and provide guidance on the next steps. Testing Considerations: Verify that only Master Admins can revoke access. Ensure that access revocation immediately removes the user from the child unitID’s user list. Validate that reinstating access restores previous configurations unless outdated. Confirm that actions are logged appropriately for audit purposes.

issues.summary: Ensure that Master Admins are ONLY able to see the child unitIDs in another user's record, which they themselves have access to.
issues.description: Business Case:   Master Admins in a Parent unitID have the ability to manage access for other users to child unitIDs linked to the Parent unitID they are currently logged into. However, a Master Admin should only be able to assign access to child unitIDs that they themselves have access to. Additionally, if a user’s record contains child unitIDs that the Master Admin does not have access to, those unitIDs should remain hidden from the Master Admin. This ensures that sensitive access information remains restricted, maintaining the principle of least privilege and preventing unnecessary exposure of data. Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The Master Admin must be logged into the Parent unitID. The user record being accessed should contain child unitIDs that may or may not overlap with the Master Admin’s accessible unitIDs. User Record Access & Visibility Constraints: Master Admins should be able to access another user's record via the user management screen in the Parent unitID. When opening a user’s record, the system should display the child unitIDs that the user currently has access to. The only exception to the above rule is that the system should filter out any child unitIDs that the Master Admin does not have access to. The Master Admin should neither see these restricted child unitIDs as selected, nor as selectable options in the user record. Handling of Hidden Child unitIDs: If a user has access to child unitIDs that the Master Admin does not, the system should present the user record as if the user has no access to those unitIDs. There should be no indication that additional child unitIDs exist outside the Master Admin’s scope. Assignment Restrictions: When modifying a user’s child unitID access, the Master Admin should only be able to assign unitIDs that they themselves have access to. Testing Considerations: Verify that a Master Admin can only see and assign child unitIDs that they have access to. Validate that when a Master Admin opens a user record, restricted child unitIDs remain hidden. Test various permission scenarios, including: A Master Admin with full access to all child unitIDs. A Master Admin with limited access to specific child unitIDs. A Master Admin attempting to modify a user’s access beyond their scope.

issues.summary: Allow Parent unitID Master Admins to configure SSO settings from the Parent unitID for all linked child unitIDs
issues.description: The SSO config screen should ONLY be visible in the Parent UnitID The SSO config screen should be read-only in the linked child unitIDs When the Admin configures SSO settings for their company; from the Parent unitID, those configs should be saved in ALL the linked child unitIDs The SSO ID field; in the user record, should ONLY be editable in the Parent unitID, for users that were created in that parent unitID Users, that were originally created via the Parent unitID, will no longer be visible in the linked Child unitIDs ( future ticket ). The SSO ID field; in the user record, should be editable in the child unitID, for users that were directly created in that child unitID The SSO ID field in the user record will be editable in the child unitID for such users.  We need to figure out what changes may need to be made to the actual SSO login logic, to allow all users belonging to the same company, to be directed into the correct unitID, without relying on unitID specific identifiers in the SSO Consumer URL.  We will need a data-fix for existing users that have SSO IDs, as well as for replicating the SSO configs across all linked unitIDs (Parent + Children).  We need to make sure that the SSO Consumer URL for each child unitID should be the same as the SSO Consumer URL of the Parent unitID.

issues.summary: Allow Parent unitID Admins to update existing user records, and propagate changes to appropriate child unitIDs
issues.description: Info added based on discussion on 01/02/2025:  If a Master Admin is restricted to a subset of child unitIDs, any user record they open up, they should be able to see all the child unitIDs that user has access to. However, they can only assign, view and configure access for the child unitIDs that they themselves have access to.  Info added based on discussion on 01/16/2025:  This ticket will  NOT  deal with scenarios related to revoking access to a specific child unitID, from the user record in the Parent unitID. Business Case: Master Admins need a way to provision and manage accounts for users that will be granted access to multiple child unitIDs. We need to introduce a user management screen to enable this. We also need to update the user record modal to allow Master Admins to configure an individual user’s settings for each child unitID they will have access to.   Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The currently logged in user must be a Master Admin.  The user should be present in the Parent unitID.  The user must have already opened an existing user record, and the system should have already loaded all child unitID configs for that user record.  What can the Master Admin do on the user modal, when editing the user record? Screen 1 Screen 2 Screen 3 When a Master Admin clicks on the “Create a new user” button, the system should display the standard user creation modal to them.  This modal will be different in the following ways from the standard user creation modal shown in child / standalone unitIDs:  In the “Basic Information“ section of the modal, there should be a new single-select drop-down field.  This field should be titled “Primary user Role“.  This drop-down should list 2 options; “Master Administrator“ & “Non-Administrator“.  This field should be empty by default on the modal.  This field should be a required field.  if the user does not select a value in this field, the field should be highlighted with a red border, and the “Save User” button on the modal should remain disabled.  Under the “Basic Information” section, there should be a new section added to the modal, titled “Business Unit Configuration“.  This new section should have the following controls:  A first multi-select type-ahead field titled “Allow access to these business units“. The user should see options for the child unitIDs connected to the currently logged in Parent unitID. The options list should present these options using their respective Company Name values.  The user should be able to search for an option by it’s name, by typing the search terms into the field.  The user should be able to select more than one of these options.  Any option already selected by the user, should no longer be presented as a selectable option in the list.  The selected values should be displayed in the field, in individual “pills”. With a “x” in each pill, to allow the user to remove/deselect one of these choices.  The second single-select type-ahead field titled “User settings for“, should only become visible once the Master Admin has selected at least 1 option in the 1st field.  This drop-down should only present; as options, the choices that the the Master Admin has already selected in the 1st field.  The options should be presented using the child unitID’s company name value.  The user should ONLY be able to select 1 of the listed options at a time.  There should be an informational message in this section, below the fields mentioned above.  The message should be preceded by a yellow “?” (already used elsewhere in the application)  Under this image, there should be the message “Please allow the user to access one or more business units, in order to configure the user's settings for that account.“ This message should be visible whilst the user hasn’t selected any value in the 1st field.  Once the user select’s a value in the 1st field, but has yet to select one in the 2nd field, this message should be replaced by a new message, stating “Please select a business unit, for which you would like to configure this user's account settings.“ The updated message, as well as the “?” image should disappear once the user select's a value in the 2nd field.  The other standard sections of the user modal should be hidden by default.  These sections should ONLY become visible once the Master Admin selects a value for the 2nd field mentioned above.  Every time the Master Admin changes the selection within the 2nd field, the other sections below the “Business Unit Configuration“ section, should be reloaded to reflect the data/settings for the respective child unitID.  All data / configurations from these sections should ONLY be applicable to the user’s record in the child unitID that is currently selected on the modal.  The “Save User” button should remain disabled, until the Master Admin has filled out all required fields on the modal.

issues.summary: Allow a Parent unitID's user to edit their own profile from a child unitID
issues.description: Business Case: Users; that were originally created within the Parent unitID, that are now present in a Child unitID should be able to edit their own profile, in order to make any necessary changes. They must be able to access these settings from their “My Profile” screen, as they will not have access to their own user record, from the user management screen.   Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The user must be logged into the Parent unitID The user must have navigated into a Child unitID that they have access to The user can have either the Master Admin, or a Non-admin user role within the context of the Parent unitID The user must have one or more roles assigned to them within the context of the Child unitID. Accessing the profile screen: The user should be able to click on the icon / avatar at the top of the left nav bar, and access their profile screen Users within the Child unitID should continue being able to access their “My Data” screen as well. There is no ticket for this screen, since there is no change that is expected to be made to the functionality of this screen.   Allowing the user to see / edit specific information on their profile screen: The user should ONLY see the “ Personal Details ” section, and NOT see the “ Change Password “ section on this screen. All other sections should be visible to the user on this screen, based on their assigned roles within the current Child UnitID, including: OoO settings Alternate Approver / Buyer settings My System Preferences My Document Defaults Within the “ Personal Details ” section, the “ PIN Code ” field should be visible, and editable. Users will only be able to set their PIN Code within the context of a Child unitID. Outside of the Personal Details section, users should be able to edit any information on this screen, that they are able to see. Any changes made by the user, via this screen, should be persisted in their Parent unitID user record, as well as propagated to the replica user record within the current Child unitID.

issues.summary: Allow a Parent unitID's user to edit their own profile from the Parent unitID
issues.description: Business Case: Users logged into the Parent unitID should be able to edit their own profile, in order to make any necessary changes. They must be able to access these settings from their “My Profile” screen, as they will not have access to their own user record, from the user management screen. Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The user must be logged into the Parent unitID The user can have either the Master Admin, or a Non-admin user role within the context of the Parent unitID Accessing the profile screen: The user should be able to click on the icon / avatar at the top of the left nav bar, and access their profile screen Allowing the user to see / edit specific information on their profile screen: The user should ONLY see the “ Personal Details ” and “ Change Password “ sections on this screen. All other sections should be hidden on this screen, including: OoO settings Alternate Approver settings My System Preferences My Document Defaults Within the “ Personal Details ” section, the “ PIN Code ” field should be hidden. Users should be able to edit any information on this screen, that they are able to see.  Any changes made by the user, via this screen, should be persisted in their Parent unitID user record, as well as propagated to any replica user records within Child unitIDs.

issues.summary: Allow a Master Admin to activate / deactivate user records from a parent unitID
issues.description: Business Case: Master Admins managing users across multiple child unitIDs need the ability to activate or deactivate user records directly from the Parent unitID. This feature will ensure consistent user access control across the system, reducing manual work and the risk of mismanagement. When a user’s record is activated or deactivated (which can be done from the user management grid, or by dismissing an assigned child unitID from the user modal) in the Parent unitID, the system should propagate the change to the relevant child unitIDs, ensuring appropriate access and configurations are maintained or revoked automatically. Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The currently logged-in user must be a Master Admin. The user record being updated must belong to the Parent unitID and has access to at least 1 child unitID. Deactivating a User Record When a Master Admin deactivates a user’s record in the Parent unitID: The system should deactivate the affected user’s record in the Parent unitID. The system should automatically propagate the deactivation to the child unitIDs that the user had access to: Deactivate the user’s record in each of these child unitIDs. A success confirmation message should display, summarizing the changes: " The selected user records have been deactivated. " In the case of this operation failing, the system should display the following message to the user: " Oops! Something went wrong, and the selected user records could not be deactivated. " Activating a User Record When a Master Admin activates a user’s record in the Parent unitID: The system should reactivate the affected user’s record in the Parent unitID. Automatically reactivate the user’s records in all previously accessible child unitIDs. Display a success message: " The selected user records have been reactivated with their previous configurations restored. " In the case of this operation failing, the system should display the following message to the user: " Oops! Something went wrong, and the selected user records could not be reactivated. " General Requirements: The " Activate/Deactivate " actions should be available in the main user management screen as buttons or actions in a dropdown menu. Bulk activation/deactivation should be supported: If multiple records are selected, the system should display a consolidated success/failure message summarizing the results. Any errors encountered during propagation to child unitIDs should be logged, and a partial success message should be displayed, e.g., " The selected user records were < deactivated / activated> in the Parent Company Account, but some child Company Accounts failed to update. Please contact Vroozi Support with details of the user record your were tryig to update. " Audit Logging: Log every activation/deactivation action performed by the Master Admin, in the affected user’s record. Include details of: Who made the change What change was made When the change was made Whether the updates were successfully applied to all the linked Child unitID’s user records as well, or not.  If not, record this failure as a detail in the event.  Question Answer Asked by Asked on Answered by Answered on What should happen, if a Master Admin is editing an Inactive user record, and provides that user access to a child unitID? Should the user record in the child unitID be created in active, or inactive state?  We should prevent the Master Admin from assigning access to additional child unitIDs, on an inactive user record. The Master Admin should be asked to first reactivate the user record.            to split the 2nd option in the reactivation flow, into it’s own ticket. A modal dialogue; with the title “ Activate User Record “,  should prompt the Master Admin to choose how to proceed: The modal should display the message “ When activating a user, you can choose one of the following options: “ Option 1: Reactivate the user record and restore access to the same child unitIDs as previously configured. Option 2: Reactivate the user record without restoring access to child unitIDs, requiring manual reassignment and reconfiguration. There should be 2 action buttons presented to the user on this modal: “ Activate and Restore Access “ “ Only Activate “ For Option 1 ( Reactivate and Restore Access ): For Option 2 ( Only Reactivate ): The system should reactivate the affected user’s record in the Parent unitID. Remove the user’s access to all previously configured child unitIDs, and soft-delete the affected user’s record(s) in the child unitIDs that they’re losing access to.  Automatically open the user record modal for reconfiguration (if activating a single user): The modal should display a message: " Please configure the user’s access to child unitIDs. " If multiple user records are activated in one go, skip opening the user record modal. Display a success message: " The selected <user record has / user records have> been reactivated in the Parent Company Account. Child Company Account access has been removed. "

issues.summary: Parent unitID - Admin: Allow a Master Admin to view the child unitID specific configurations, for existing user records, in the Parent unitID.
issues.description: Info added based on discussion on 01/02/2025:  If a Master Admin is restricted to a subset of child unitIDs, any user record they open up, they should be able to see all the child unitIDs that user has access to. However, they can only assign, view and configure access for the child unitIDs that they themselves have access to.  Business Case: Master Admins need a way to provision and manage accounts for users that will be granted access to multiple child unitIDs. We need to introduce a user management screen to enable this. We also need to update the user record modal to allow Master Admins to configure an individual user’s settings for each child unitID they will have access to.   Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The currently logged in user must be a Master Admin.  The user should be present in the Parent unitID.  How can a Master Admin edit an existing user record?  The user should be able to open an existing user record by clicking on it’s “First Name”, in the table, on the main user management screen.  Once the user modal is open, the data already configured for that user record should be prefilled in.  By default, the modal should display the settings/configurations/data applicable to the first child unitID that the user has access to.  The Master Admin should be able to switch between a user’s child unitID’s and their respective settings/configurations/data by changing the selection in the “User settings for“ field.

issues.summary: Parent unitID - Admin Users: Enable Admins to edit the name and description for the linked child unitIDs.
issues.description: This ticket was split from   , on 10/21/2024 at the dev team’s request, to simplify testing efforts. It is only meant to deal with the original tickets' requirements for making the cells in the first 2 columns of the table editable. See the section highlighted in  Red .  Business Case: As a standard feature, all users that log into a Parent unitID must be able to access a list of child unitIDs that they can navigate to, in order to conduct business. This should be available to Non-admin users in the Parent unitID by default, and to Admin users as an option (once we introduce the reporting dashboard for them).  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The unitID must be configured to work as a Parent unitID There must be at least 2 Child unitIDs connected to it.  The user logging in has access to child unitIDs and must be a Parent unitID user How should the user be able to get to this list of Child unitIDs? When the user logs into the Parent unitID, this is the screen they should land on.  If the user is on another screen in the Parent unitID, they should be able to navigate to this screen by clicking on the “Business Units” link in the left nav bar.  What should the user see on this screen when they land on it? The user should see a message at the top of the screen.  This message should read “ TBD “. The user should be able to dismiss this message by clicking on a “Close” button in the section containing the message.  However, this message should reappear when the user logs into the application again. While still logged in, if the user dismisses the message, there is no need to display it again, for the duration of that logged in session.  When the user navigatess back to the Parent unitID, from a child unitID, the system can once again display the message, unless the user had previously clocked on the “Don’t show again“ checkbox.  The user should be able to dismiss the message for good, by checking the “Don’t show again“ checkbox next to the “Close” button.  The user should see the page title as “Business Units“ The user should see a table below that, with the following columns:  Business Unit Description Last Accessed on Action The Business Unit column should list all the Child unitIDs linked to the current Parent unitID, that the logged in user has access to. By default, this list should display the values found in these Child unitID’s Company  → Profile → Company Name field.  The Description column should only display a value if the Parent unitID Admin provides a description for this Child unitID. Otherwise, the column can show an “n/a” for rows that do not have a description.  The Last Accessed on column should display the most recent date that the user navigated to that specific child unitID. This value should be updated by the system, every time the user navigates to that specific Child unitID.  The Action column should include icons for the following controls:  Edit The Edit icon should ONLY be available to the user if they have the Parent unitID Admin role assigned.  The Edit icon should be a pencil glyph Clicking on this should make the first 2 cells for that specific row editable. and change the pencil icon to a “save” icon (perhaps a “tick mark”).  The cell in the Business Unit column is mandatory. The user should not be able to save the row without providing some value in this cell. This cell CANNOT use the same value as another Child unitID that’s connected to the current Parent unitID. If the user enters such a value, the system should highlight the text input field with a red border, and display a red “!” icon in the input field; aligned to the right edge of the field. Hovering over this icon should display a tool-tip with the message “TBD“.  The cell in the Description column is optional. The user can save the row without providing a value in this field if they don’t want to.  Navigate to The Navigate to icon should be visible to all users that log into the Parent unitID and have access to that specific Child unitID.  The Navigate to icon should be a square with an arrow pointing up and to the right, out of it.  Clicking on this should navigate the user to that specific child unitID, in the same browser tab.  How many unitIDs will be listed in this table? There is no restriction at the moment, on how many child unitIDs can be linked to a parent unitID, or how many of those a single user can be given access to.  The table should list a maximum of 10 rows, after which it should paginate the data.

issues.summary: Parent / Child unitID - All users: Allow users to navigate from the Parent unitID to a specific child unitID
issues.description: Business Case: We need to enable users with access to multiple child untiIDs, to navigate to those unitID’s, from the parent unitID. These users should also be able to navigate back to the Parent unitID, and even jump to another child unitID, from the one they’re already present in. This ticket build upon the following previous JIRAs:         Acceptance Criteria: Prequisites: The user must be logged into the Parent unitID.  The user must have access to Child unitIDs.  How can a user navigate from the Parent unitID, to a child untiID? When the user logs into the Parent unitID, they will be presented with this list of child unitID’s they have access to. (See   for details) This list will be populated based on the data in the user’s record. (See   for details) The user can either click on the child unitID’s name, or the “ → “ icon for that row.  Clicking on either will navigate the user to that specific child unitID, in the same browser window/tab.  How will the user know when they are in a child unitID? When the user is in a child unitID, the application will include a persistent header at the top of the standard Vroozi UI.  This header will include the message “You are currently logged into <Business Unit>“.  Where the value of <Business Unit> will be dynamically determined based on the specific child unitID’s Company Name value.  This header will remain in place as long as the user is present in the child unitID, to ensure that they are always aware of the context in which they are operating.  How will the user navigate back to the Parent unitID? At any point, if the user feels like navigating back to the parent unitID that they originally logged into, they can click the “Go back to <Business Unit>“ button.  The value of <Business Unit> in this case will be determined dynamically based on the company name value of the Parent unitID.  This button will be a persistent presence in the header mentioned above.  When the user clicks on this button, the system will navigate the user to the landing screen of the Parent unitID, in the same browser window/tab.  once they’re back in the parent unitID, the persistent banner; mentioned above, will no longer be visible on the screen.  How can a user navigate to another child unitID, from the one they’re currently logged into? At any point; whilst logged into a child unitID, if the user feels like navigating to a different child unitID, they can do so by using the unitID selection control in the persistent header.  There will be a single-select drop-down field in the header, labeled “Switch Business Unit:“.  This drop-down will present as a list of options, the child unitIDs that the user has access to, based on their user record. (See   for details) This drop-down must display; as the selected option, the child unitID that the user is currently present in.  The user can click into this drop-down and change the selection to another child unitID that they have access to.  When they do so, the application should navigate them to the selected child unit in the same browser window/tab.

issues.summary: Parent unitID - Admin: Allow a Master Admin user to create users in the Parent unitID
issues.description: Business Case: Master Admins need a way to provision and manage accounts for users that will be granted access to multiple child unitIDs. We need to introduce a user management screen to enable this. We also need to update the user record modal to allow Master Admins to configure an individual user’s settings for each child unitID they will have access to.   Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The currently logged in user must be a Master Admin.  The user should be present in the Parent unitID.  How should the Master Admin access the user management screen? The user should be able to see a navigation option in the left nav bar titled “Users“.  Clicking on this link should navigate the user to the User management screen.  This screen should be similar to the standard Vroozi user management screen in child / standalone unitIDs.  Note: This ticket does not cover the Bulk Upload Functionality for this screen.  The Master Admin should be able to perform all the standard CRUD operations related to user records, from this screen. Including:  User creation User activation / deactivation User deletion How should a Master Admin add a new user record? Screen 1 Screen 2 Screen 3 When a Master Admin clicks on the “Create a new user” button, the system should display the standard user creation modal to them.  This modal will be different in the following ways from the standard user creation modal shown in child / standalone unitIDs:  In the “Basic Information“ section of the modal, there should be a new single-select drop-down field.  This field should be titled “Primary user Role“.  This drop-down should list 2 options; “Master Administrator“ & “Non-Administrator“.  This field should be empty by default on the modal.  This field should be a required field.  if the user does not select a value in this field, the field should be highlighted with a red border, and the “Save User” button on the modal should remain disabled.  Under the “Basic Information” section, there should be a new section added to the modal, titled “Business Unit Configuration“.  This new section should have the following controls:  A first multi-select type-ahead field titled “Allow access to these business units“. The user should see options for the child unitIDs connected to the currently logged in Parent unitID. The options list should present these options using their respective Company Name values.  The user should be able to search for an option by it’s name, by typing the search terms into the field.  The user should be able to select more than one of these options.  Any option already selected by the user, should no longer be presented as a selectable option in the list.  The selected values should be displayed in the field, in individual “pills”. With a “x” in each pill, to allow the user to remove/deselect one of these choices.  The second single-select type-ahead field titled “User settings for“, should only become visible once the Master Admin has selected at least 1 option in the 1st field.  This drop-down should only present; as options, the choices that the the Master Admin has already selected in the 1st field.  The options should be presented using the child unitID’s company name value.  The user should ONLY be able to select 1 of the listed options at a time.  There should be an informational message in this section, below the fields mentioned above.  The message should be preceded by a yellow “?” (already used elsewhere in the application)  Under this image, there should be the message “Please allow the user to access one or more business units, in order to configure the user's settings for that account.“ This message should be visible whilst the user hasn’t selected any value in the 1st field.  Once the user select’s a value in the 1st field, but has yet to select one in the 2nd field, this message should be replaced by a new message, stating “Please select a business unit, for which you would like to configure this user's account settings.“ The updated message, as well as the “?” image should disappear once the user select's a value in the 2nd field.  The other standard sections of the user modal should be hidden by default.  These sections should ONLY become visible once the Master Admin selects a value for the 2nd field mentioned above.  Every time the Master Admin changes the selection within the 2nd field, the other sections below the “Business Unit Configuration“ section, should be reloaded to reflect the data/settings for the respective child unitID.  All data / configurations from these sections should ONLY be applicable to the user’s record in the child unitID that is currently selected on the modal.  The “Save User” button should remain disabled, until the Master Admin has filled out all required fields on the modal.  Should the user history functionality be split out into a separate ticket? Or will that just work out of the box?  Need a new ticket for the user audit trail.  How should the user be informed that their account has been provisioned in the Parent unitID? The user whose account has just been created, should receive the standard account creation confirmation email.  This email should allow them to create a password for the Parent unitID.

By default, this list should display the values found in these Child unitID’s Company  → Profile → Company Name field. The Last Accessed on column should display the most recent date that the user navigated to that specific child unitID. This value should be updated by the system, every time the user navigates to that specific Child unitID.  The Action column should include icons for the following controls:  Edit The Edit icon should ONLY be available to the user if they have the Parent unitID Admin role assigned.  The Edit icon should be a pencil glyph Clicking on this should make the first 2 cells for that specific row editable. and change the pencil icon to a “save” icon (perhaps a “tick mark”). This cell CANNOT use the same value as another Child unitID that’s connected to the current Parent unitID. If the user enters such a value, the system should highlight the text input field with a red border, and display a red “!” icon in the input field; aligned to the right edge of the field. Hovering over this icon should display a tool-tip with the message “ TBD “.  The cell in the Description column is optional. The user can save the row without providing a value in this field if they don’t want to.  Navigate to The Navigate to icon should be visible to all users that log into the Parent unitID and have access to that specific Child unitID.  The Navigate to icon should be a square with an arrow pointing up and to the right, out of it.  Clicking on this should navigate the user to that specific child unitID, in the same browser tab.  The requirements above; which have been  strikethrough , are going to be handled in    How many unitIDs will be listed in this table? The table should list a maximum of 10 rows, after which it should paginate the data.

issues.summary: Allow the system to always direct users of a Parent unitID, to that unitID when logging in
issues.description: Business Case: When a user belonging to a “Parent” unitID; as defined in   , logs into the system with their username & password, Vroozi needs a way to identify this user and upon authenticating them, must route them into the parent unitID, instead of a child unitID. Alternatively, if the user logging into the system is identified as NOT belonging to a parent unitID, they should be directed to the single child unitID that they belong to, as usual.  Why do this? Why don’t we just log the parent unitID’s user directly into the parent unitID, like we do for child unitID users? The reason we are adding this logic to the authentication process is because, in the future, we will want to allow Admins in the parent unitID to selectively “upgrade” a child unitID’s user to a parent unitID user. Whereby, when that upgraded user logs into Vroozi in the future, we will want to route them to the parent unitID, instead of the child unitID their user account was originally created in.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The feature flag added in    should be enabled for this parent unitID.  There should be at least 1 child unitID linked to this parent unitID.  One or more users should exist in this parent unitID and be active.  One or more users should exist in the linked child unitID(s) and be active.  There should be a way to identify users with access to a parent unitID. This identifier could, in the futre, be used for reporting as well.  When the user enters their username/passwrod combination on the Vroozi login screen, and submits it to the BE service for processing, the system should fetch the user’s record from the DB based on the provided credentials.  From this user record, the system needs to determine if this user has access to the parent unitID, or to a child unitID. If the system determines that the user belongs to a parent unitID, then the user should be routed to the relevant parent unitID.  If the system determines that the user does not belong to a parent unitID, then the user should be routed to the appropriate child unitID that they belong to.   to create a separate ticket for this requirement below:   A user CANNOT exist in multiple child unitIDs without also belonging to a parent unitID.

issues.summary: Enable Vroozi Ops to define a Parent unitID's Child unitIDs
issues.description: Business Case: We need to enable specific users in Maersk to oversee, and to some degree, manage the multiple Vroozi unitIDs that they will be using in PROD. We do NOT want to change how indivudal unitIDs are provisioned, or run on a given server. However, we want to enable the creation of a “Parent” entity over an arbitrary number of individual unitIDs. This “Parent” will be used to view aggregrate reporting data against all the child unitIDs, and also wo provision user accounts for users that need to access multiple child unitIDs.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: The feature toggle introduced in    should be enabled for the unitID.  Vroozi should be able to specify an arbitrary number of active unitIDs on a given server, as “Child” unitIDs of the current “Parent” unitID.  A single unitID cannot be the “Child” of multiple “Parent” unitIDs.  A unitID that is already flagged as a “Parent” unitID cannot be the “Child” unitID of another parent.  A unitID that is already a “Child” unitID and is linked to an eisting “Parent”, cannot be designated as a Parent unitID.  It should be possible for Vroozi to establish this link between parent/child unitIDs at both unitID creation time, as well as after the fact.  We will need to create data-fix scripts for use by Ops, which will:  Convert an existing unitID into a Child unitID of an existing Parent unitID Convert multiple existing unitIDs into Child unitIDs of an existing Parent unitID

epic.description: Develop the Invoice Dispute Process to enable clients to manage invoice discrepancies effectively with the Supplier.

issues.summary: Supplier Portal: SP User Actions (3-dots) for Disputed Invoices
issues.description: Business Case: This enhancement enables Supplier Portal users to quickly and clearly address disputed invoices by providing intuitive action options (View or Edit). By streamlining the dispute resolution process, it reduces confusion, accelerates invoice corrections, and ultimately enhances supplier satisfaction and operational efficiency. Context -   and    Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? As a  Supplier Portal (SP)  user, I want to see appropriate action options for invoices that are in " Disputed " status so that I can effectively manage invoice disputes. Which customers should this change impact? Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact? Supplier Portal > Invoices page Which users should be impacted by the change? SP User. How should this feature work? Invoice Action Options: For any invoice in "Disputed" status, the SP user should see two distinct action options when clicking the 3 dots against the invoice: View Invoice. Edit Invoice. View Invoice Action: Clicking on  "View Invoice"  opens the invoice in a  non-editable  (read-only) view. The user sees the standard set of invoice options:  Void, Amend, and Reject . Edit Invoice Action: Clicking on  "Edit Invoice"  moves the invoice directly into an  "Amend"  state. Invoice immediately becomes editable, allowing modifications. All standard editing functionalities applicable to invoices in the "Amend" state are available to the user. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

issues.summary: Exclude voided invoices for Final Invoice calculation
issues.description: Business Case: Voided Invoices should be excluded from final invoice calculations.  To know more about final invoices see tickets:      Epic:    Acceptance Criteria: When an invoice is marked as final, and posted the related PO is closed for receiving or invoicing as per the mentioned ticket describes. So when doing the calculation of how many items were received or invoiced by partial invoices, voided invoices should not be taken into account (as if they were deleted). When there is a voided partial invoice referencing the same PO, it shouldn’t be considered to display the warning message when submitting a final invoice.

issues.summary: View and Search Disputed and Voided Invoices in Document Flow
issues.description: Business Case: Users currently do not have the capability to search for  Disputed  or  Voided  invoices in the Document Flow page. Providing this functionality will enable users to easily locate and review these invoice types, enhancing overall visibility and document management. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? Implement the capability to search and view Disputed and Voided invoices in the Document Flow page, including the ability to view high-level invoice details and linked documents. Which customers should this change impact? Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true. What pages should this change impact? Document Flow Which users should be impacted by the change? Admin AP Manager Invoice assignee / group (targetUserId / group) Invoice creator (userId) Invoice owner (apProcessorId) Employee of the PO Buyer of the PO Users who were assigned to the invoice at some point, e.g.: Exception Handlers Invoice Approver Invoice Coder Invoice Assignee (user who is explicitly assigned an invoice) How should this feature work? Disputed and Voided invoices appear in search results when matching search criteria. Users can view high-level details of Disputed or Voided invoices by clicking the Eye (👁️) icon. Users can view documents linked to Disputed or Voided invoices by clicking the Tree (🌳) icon. Users' access is controlled according to their defined role and historical interactions. Users without appropriate permissions will not see Disputed or Voided invoices in their results. Example : Admins: Can search and view all Disputed and Voided invoices. AP Managers: Can search and view all Disputed and Voided invoices. AP Processors: Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices that were created by them, assigned to them, or were disputed by them with the supplier. Employee: Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices if they are the owner of the PO linked to this Invoice. Buyer: Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices if they are the owner of the PO linked to this Invoice. Exception Handler: Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices if they were assigned to the Invoice at some point of time. AP Approver: Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices if they were assigned to the Invoice at some point of time. AP Coder: Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices if they were assigned to the Invoice at some point of time. Invoice Assignee   (user who was explicitly assigned to the invoice) : Can search and view Disputed and Voided invoices if they were assigned to the Invoice at some point of time. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

issues.summary: UI Enhancements for Dispute Destination Dialog Box Fields
issues.description: Business Case: Enhance the UI of the  Dispute Destination Dialog Box  to improve clarity and usability of the  Reason(s)  field and overall layout. Review comment in this ticket for more context -    Acceptance Criteria: What is the change? As a  user submitting a dispute , I want the  Reason(s)  field to be clearer, better aligned, and easier to read when multiple reasons are selected, So that I can accurately understand and review the dispute reasons without confusion. Which customers should this change impact? Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Invoices in these statuses - Draft. Parked. Rejected. Which users should be impacted by the change? Document creator/owner (AP Processor). Any AP Manager How should this feature work? Field Title Update: Update the field title from  " Reason* "  to  "Reason(s)*"  to reflect that multiple dispute reasons can be selected. Field Alignment & Length: Increase the length of the  Reason(s)  field so that it aligns with other fields in the  Dispute Destination Dialog Box  for a consistent UI. Improved Multi-Selection Display: Modify the way multiple dispute reasons are displayed in the  Reason(s)  field. Instead of truncating selections (which currently limits visibility to 1 or 2 reasons), display multiple reasons in a  stacked format (one below the other)  similar to how the  Company Code Restrictions  field is displayed in the system today. Ensure users can clearly see all selected dispute reasons without needing to expand the field. If the text exceeds the field size, the user can hover over the reason to view the full text. Spacing Improvement: Reduce the space between the  Dispute sub-text  and the  warning message  within the dialog box to improve readability and maintain a cleaner layout. Re-positioning of the Dispute Via field: Move the  Dispute Via field  above the User field in the  Dispute Destination Dialog Box . Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  Maybe. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

issues.summary: Payables: Exclude Voided Invoices from Overdue Email Notifications
issues.description: Business Case: As a  system , I want to ensure that invoices with a  Voided  status do not trigger overdue email notifications once their payment due date has passed, so that AP users are not unnecessarily notified about invoices that are no longer valid or actionable. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  System should not trigger overdue email notification once their payment due date has passed for Voided status invoices. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true. What pages should this change impact?  Navigation Panel > Track Invoices. Which users should be impacted by the change? AP Processor. AP Manager. How should this feature work? Key Feature: Overdue handling for Voided invoices : Voided invoices should not go into overdue status. Voided invoices should not show up in Track Overdue Invoice page. Overdue invoice page should not showcase the filter for status = voided. If an invoice has a status of  Voided , it should not trigger overdue email notifications even if the  Payment Due Date  has passed. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. issues.summary: Supplier Portal / Payables: Display Dispute Reason, Comments, and Resolution at the Top of the Invoice Page
issues.description: Business Case: I want to be able to see the dispute reason and any comments provided by the  AP user , at the top of the invoice when it is sent to the  SP user  for dispute resolution. Additionally, as soon as the  SP user  has made a decision (e.g., Void, Amend, or Reject) and submitted their resolution, I should be able to see the resolution choice and corresponding comments at the top of the invoice page once it returns from the dispute process. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  AP and SP Users should be able to see the dispute reason, dispute resolution decision and comments at the top of the invoice page. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Invoice page. Which users should be impacted by the change? SP User. AP Processor. AP Manager. Any user who is able to view the Invoice (ex: Admin, Requester, etc.) How should this feature work? Key Features: Display of AP Dispute Reason & Comments to SP: Given an invoice is sent to the SP user as "Disputed," When the SP user opens the disputed invoice page, Then the AP user's dispute reason and any comments provided are displayed at the top of the invoice page. Visibility of SP Resolution & Comments to AP: Given the SP user has submitted a dispute resolution decision (Void/Amend/Reject) along with resolution comments, When the invoice returns to the AP user's view post-dispute resolution, Then the SP user's chosen resolution and any resolution comments are prominently displayed at the top of the invoice page. When the supplier voids the Invoice: Comment Example - “This invoice was submitted twice, voiding the duplicate.” Resolution:  Invoice voided When the supplier rejects the dispute: Comment Example - “The dispute is invalid; no changes required.” Resolution:  Dispute rejected When the supplier amends the invoice: Comment Example - “The invoice has been updated.” Resolution:  Invoice amended Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. issues.summary: Payables: Email Notifications for Disputed Invoices and Supplier Actions
issues.description: Business Case: Introduce email notifications for all key actions related to disputed invoices, ensuring timely communication between AP users and suppliers during the dispute resolution process. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  Send email notifications to AP and SP users for all key actions in the invoice dispute lifecycle. Notifications include links to the invoice and are triggered for the following actions mentioned in the Key Features below. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Email notification. Which users should be impacted by the change? SP User. AP Processor. AP Manager. How should this feature work? Key Features : Email Notification for SP User Receiving  Dispute : An email is sent to the  SP user  to whom the invoice was sent for  dispute  resolution . Subject Line:   "Invoice [Supplier Invoice number:  Inv-2345 ] sent to you for  Dispute  resolution." When the SP user clicks on the  View Invoice  button in the email notification: The system should  redirect  the SP user to the Supplier Portal login page (based on the Unit ID’s Supplier Portal URL). After successfully logging in, the system should  directly open the disputed invoice page . Invoice Template for SP user at time of dispute submission - Email Notification for  Void  Resolution : An email notification is triggered when the SP user submits a  Void resolution . Subject Line:   "Invoice [Vroozi Invoice number:  9000056789 ] has been  Voided  by the Supplier." The email is sent to the  AP user  who originally submitted the invoice for dispute. When the AP user clicks on the  View Invoice  button in the email notification: The system should  redirect  the AP user to the Purchase Manager’s login page. After successfully logging in, the system should  directly open the disputed invoice page . Invoice Template for AP user at time of Void resolution submission  - Email Notification for  Amend  Resolution : An email notification is triggered when the SP user submits an  Amend resolution . Subject Line:   "Invoice [Vroozi Invoice number:  9000056789 ] has been  Amended  by the Supplier." The email is sent to the  AP user  who originally submitted the invoice for dispute. When the AP user clicks on the  View Invoice  button in the email notification: The system should  redirect  the AP user to the Purchase Manager’s login page. After successfully logging in, the system should  directly open the disputed invoice page . Invoice Template for AP user at time of Amend resolution submission  - Email Notification for  Reject  Resolution : An email notification is triggered when the SP user submits a  Reject resolution . Subject Line:   "Invoice [Vroozi Invoice number:  9000056789 ] has been  Returned without changes  by the Supplier." The email is sent to the AP user who originally submitted the invoice for dispute. When the AP user clicks on the  View Invoice  button in the email notification: The system should  redirect  the AP user to the Purchase Manager’s login page. After successfully logging in, the system should  directly open the disputed invoice page . Invoice Template for AP user at time of Reject resolution submission  - Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. issues.summary: Supplier Portal: Handling Disputed Invoices on SP Side
issues.description: Business Case: Allow Supplier Portal Users to review and take action on disputed invoices assigned to them. Acceptance Criteria: What is the change?  Allow Supplier Portal Users to review and take action on disputed invoices assigned to them. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE_WORKFLOW  = true, and  Dispute Invoice via Supplier Portal  toggle = ON. What pages should this change impact?  Supplier Portal > Disputed Invoice. Which users should be impacted by the change? SP User. How should this feature work? Disputed Invoice View Mode : When the SP user opens a disputed invoice assigned to them, the invoice opens in  view mode . Action Buttons  are displayed at the bottom of the invoice page, corresponding to the three choices: Void   (Gray button) Amend   (Blue button) Reject   (Red button) Action Buttons and Their Functions : Choice 1 - Void: Button Color:   Gray Action: If the SP user clicks on the  Void  button: Check this ticket for implementation -    Choice 2 - Amend: Button Color:   Blue Action: If the SP user clicks on the  Amend  button: The system updates the  view mode  on the invoice to  edit mode , allowing the SP user to make changes to the invoice. The invoice remains in  Disputed  status. All buttons below the invoice are replaced with: A  Return to AP  button. A  three-dot menu  beside the Return to AP button. Return to AP Button: Disabled by Default: The  Return to AP  button remains  active  by default. Clicking Return to AP: Opens the  Invoice Destination section  with the following: Next Action Text:  Return to AP Subtext:  The invoice will be returned to AP for processing after amendments. Warning Message:   Warning:   Please confirm that all details are accurate before submitting the invoice to Accounts Payable. An  Optional  Comments field  where the SP user can add additional details about the amendments made. A  Submit button  that submits the invoice back to the AP side. Three-Dot Menu: Clicking the Three-Dot Menu: Opens the  Invoice Destination section  with two alternative options: Void Reject Selecting Void or Reject: Triggers the respective implementation for that choice. A  Show All Actions  button is displayed, allowing the SP user to revisit the choice selection screen in the Invoice Destination Box. Submission Process: Once the SP user submits the invoice after making amendments: The invoice status changes to: In Process  on the SP side. Draft  on the AP side. The invoice is reassigned to the AP user for further action. Choice 3 - Reject: Button Color:   Red Action: If the SP user clicks on the  Reject  button: The  Invoice Destination Box  opens with the following: Next Action Text:  Reject Sub-text:  The invoice will be returned to AP without changes. Warning Message:   Warning:   Please ensure the reason for rejecting the dispute is clear before submitting. A  Comment Field  that is  mandatory , requiring the SP user to explain the reason for rejecting the dispute. A  Submit Button  that remains  disabled  until text is entered in the Comment Field. Upon Submission: The invoice is sent back to the AP user  without any changes . The invoice status updates to: In Process  on the SP side. Draft  on the AP side. The invoice is  reassigned  to the AP user. No Action Taken by SP User: If the SP user does not take any action on the disputed invoice, the invoice remains in  Disputed  status on both the SP and AP sides. Audit History Updates: All actions taken by the SP user (e.g., selection, comments, submissions) are logged in the  Audit History  for transparency. When the AP user submits the Invoice for dispute: Invoice submitted for dispute AP User Name Comment Reason Dispute Via Icon - Scale-balanced    When the supplier voids the Invoice: Invoice voided SP User Name Comment Icon - Ban  When the supplier rejects the dispute: Dispute rejected SP User Name Comment Icon - X mark  When the supplier amends the invoice: Invoice amended SP User Name Comment All Invoice changes recorded inside the tile. Icon - Pencil  Mock Screenshot: Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  Maybe. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All teams. Questions: Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date             # Question Recommendation Response Remarks

issues.summary: Plant code - API Upsert call updating the same record
issues.description:
Plant code - upsert API. Issue: The middleware is sending an API request for duplicate Plant Code and description with unique external IDs. However, the API is updating the same record multiple times since the request has a duplicate code which already exists. Case: There are multiple duplicate plant codes linked with different company codes and each has unique externalIds. whenever an API request is sent with same Plant Code but unique company code and externalID. Instead of creating a new Plant code, the system is updating an existing Plant code. Sample request. payload: {'active': True, 'code': 'B005 - 809/907', 'companyCodeRef': {'id': '2403'}, 'description': '809 E. 236th St', 'externalId': '6_12'}
URL: POST plant-codes/upsert
